name: music-player
tagline: A GNOME3.10 music player written in C
body:
> It Plays Music. Oh, and videos.

![Screenshot](https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/-j8kldNJs3CA/UnUdg6XyVeI/AAAAAAAAGpM/uddRJSGGW5Q/w920-h517-no/Screenshot+from+2013-11-02+15%253A43%253A12.png)

![Screenshot2](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/--5p6jerRnco/UnZUVCjfTBI/AAAAAAAAGtA/HTguXyVZDy4/w920-h517-no/Screenshot+from+2013-11-03+13%253A49%253A03.png)
See? Plays videos. Or stalks rabbits. Easter egg..?

Features
----
 * Lightweight GTK3.10 media application
 * Very fast database for fast startup time
 * Uses GStreamer-1.0
 * Supports audio & video
 * Modern UI design
 * Client side decorations
 * Random/shuffle function, that is actually *random*. Not the track
   you just played.

Roadmap for v2
----
 * Finalize error handling
 * Allow manual re-import of library (instead of deleting database)
 * Allow configuration of directories and setting persistence

Roadmap for v3
----
 * Album art
 * Stable database format (final)

Roadmap for v4
---
 * iPod support
 * Rip media from various sources


License: GPLv2+
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
